title: Big BBQ, musical festival and art exhibition: The best things to do this week
text:
Big BBQ, musical festival and art exhibition: The best things to do this week Big BBQ, musical festival and art exhibition: The best things to do this week FEAST ALL your senses this week at a big barbecue, tapas eaterie, festival and art exhibition. PUBLISHED: PUBLISHED: 00:01, Sun, Jul 5, 2015 PH Don your apron, hunt out your tongs and take part in the Big BBQ Weekend for Cancer Research UK 
TAKE PART 
Don your apron, hunt out your tongs and take part in the Big BBQ Weekend for Cancer Research UK. Next Saturday and Sunday, the charity is inviting the whole country to fire up the barbie and party with friends and family to raise money for the cause. 
All donations will bring us one step closer to beating the disease – and who can resist a barbie-dazzled sausage? To get your barbecue pack, visit cancerresearchuk.org . 
GO TO 
The T in the Park festival takes centre stage at Balado in Kinross-shire for three days of great entertainment this Friday until Sunday. Described as the biggest party in Scotland, the festival will host a huge line-up including Kasabian, Avicii, Sam Smith and Fatboy Slim. 
Choose from up to 180 artists performing across nine stages throughout the weekend, building up to an epic finale with Noel Gallagher’s High Flying Birds. Visit tinthepark.com . 
SEE 
London’s Guildhall Art Gallery will play host to a ground-breaking new exhibition called No Colour Bar: Black British Art in Action 1960-1990 from Friday. 
The dazzling interactive collection will tell the story of 20th-century black British cultural heritage, social and political history, including works of art, sculpture and letters by famous artists such as Eddie Chambers, Sonia Boyce and Denzil Forrester. Entry is free. Call 020 7332 3700 or visit cityoflondon.gov.uk for more information. 
VISIT 
For a refreshing twist on run-of-the-mill tapas, try the newly opened Social Wine & Tapas on James Street, Marylebone, London. Hosted by The Social Company and executive sommelier Laure Patry, the restaurant offers quality, rare and fine wines alongside a tapas menu of delectable dishes by head chef Frankie Van Loo. 
Try unusual cheese and wine selections in the basement wine bar, discover new flavours at the wine-tasting table or dine with friends in the banquet area. There’s also a wine shop for those who can’t resist taking a bottle or two home. See socialwineandtapas.com or call 020 7993 3257. Related articles
